meanings.definition: The act of repeating something aloud from memory.
meanings.sent1: During the school competition, the students took turns giving recitations of famous poems.
meanings.sent2: The teacher asked the class to practice their recitations of the multiplication table.
meanings.sent3: The parrot's recitations of nursery rhymes always made the children giggle.
meanings.sent4: Her recitations of Shakespeare's sonnets painted vivid images in the minds of the audience.
meanings.sent5: The echo in the empty hall made his recitations sound even more powerful.

meanings.definition: A formal reading or presentation of a text.
meanings.sent1: The actor's recitations of the play's lines were flawless.
meanings.sent2: The poetry recitations at the event captivated the audience.
meanings.sent3: The robot's recitations of the menu items amused the customers.
meanings.sent4: Her recitations of the ancient script brought the past to life.
meanings.sent5: The recitations of the speech echoed through the grand hall.

meanings.definition: A series of repeated performances or presentations.
meanings.sent1: The music festival featured recitations by various artists.
meanings.sent2: The annual recitations of the school play were always a hit.
meanings.sent3: The cat's recitations of knocking over the vase became a daily routine.
meanings.sent4: The recitations of magic tricks amazed the audience.
meanings.sent5: The recitations of facts and figures made the presentation engaging.
